executive_summary: Somnath Kshirsagar is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2021. His current HbA1c is 8.2%, indicating a need for improved glycemic control, alongside monitoring for cardiovascular risk factors due to elevated LDL levels.

clinical_context.recent_events: 2 episodes of severe hypoglycemia in the last 90 days

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c of 8.2% indicates poor glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Implement strategies to lower HbA1c to target levels.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level of 2.5 is above the recommended target.
interpretation.plan: Consider lifestyle modifications and potential pharmacotherapy to manage LDL levels.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Limit alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Follow a Mediterranean diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with olive oil dressing
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Aim for balanced portions, focusing on whole foods and minimizing processed foods.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia, especially after exercise.

patient_goals: Achieve HbA1c of less than 7.0% within the next 6 months.
Reduce LDL levels to below 2.0 mmol/L within the next 6 months.
Increase physical activity to 150 minutes per week within 3 months.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting a statin for LDL management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, LDL levels, and overall diabetes management.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM presents with elevated HbA1c (8.2%) and LDL (2.5). Lifestyle modifications and potential medication adjustments recommended. Follow-up in 3 months.
